The second statement, "The package must have been delivered tomorrow or today", is a disjunctive statement, meaning it allows for either of the two possibilities: the package being delivered tomorrow or the package being delivered today.

If the first statement is true (the package was delivered today), then the second statement is also true because one of the disjuncts (the package being delivered today) is satisfied.
